name.paramonov.doomep.shogi

Class EmptyPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • name.paramonov.doomep.shogi.Piece
      • name.paramonov.doomep.shogi.EmptyPiece

  • public class EmptyPiece
extends Piece
    A class representing a tile on which there is no piece.
    Author:
    Dmitry Andreevich Paramonov, Jiayin Huang

      • EmptyPiece

        public EmptyPiece(int x,
          int y)
        Constructs an EmptyPiece at a given location.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-value at which this EmptyPiece is.
        y - The y-value at which this EmptyPiece is.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidMove

        protected boolean isValidMove(GameState state,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Returns whether or not this EmptyPiece can move to a given tile. As EmptyPieces can't move, this means that this always returns false.
        Specified by:
        isValidMove in class Piece
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the board before the move.
        x - The x-value of the tile to which this EmptyPiece is trying to move.
        y - The y-value of the tile to which this EmptyPiece is trying to move.
        Returns:
        Whether this EmptyPiece can move to a given tile, which is always false.

      • isPromotable

        protected boolean isPromotable()
        Returns whether or not this EmptyPiece can promote
        Specified by:
        isPromotable in class Piece
        Returns:
        Whether or not this EmptyPiece can promote, which is always false.

      • promote

        protected Piece promote()
        Returns the Piece this EmptyPiece promotes to. As EmptyPieces don't promote, returns itself.
        Specified by:
        promote in class Piece
        Returns:
        The Piece this EmptyPiece promotes to, which is itself.

      • demote

        protected Piece demote()
        Description copied from class: Piece
        Returns the piece this piece is demoted from. Each piece demotes to a different piece, and therefore is implemented individually in each subclass. This method is mostly used only in capturing, as you cannot demote normally.
        Specified by:
        demote in class Piece
        Returns:
        The piece this piece demotes to.
